qas.question: What did the soldiers rebel against in the Indian Rebellion of 1857?
What happened to the rebels of the Rebellion?
What force took control of the company and the situation?
What did the British government intend to keep in regards to India?
What did the British government remove that had caused the Rebellion?

context: The Indian rebellion of 1857 was a large-scale rebellion by soldiers employed by the British East India in northern and central India against the <a0_0>Company's rule<a0_0/>. The rebels were disorganized, had differing goals, and were poorly equipped, led, and trained, and had no outside support or funding. They were <a1_0>brutally suppressed<a1_0/> and the <a2_0>British government<a2_0/> took control of the Company and eliminated many of the <a4_0>grievances<a4_0/> that caused it. The government also was determined to keep <a3_0>full control<a3_0/> so that no rebellion of such size would ever happen again.
